meanings.definition: Make (a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling) worse.
meanings.sent1: Her loud music exacerbated the tension in the room.
meanings.sent2: The heavy rain exacerbated the flooding in the area.
meanings.sent3: His constant complaints exacerbated the boredom of the group.
meanings.sent4: The lack of sleep exacerbated her already fragile mood.
meanings.sent5: The harsh words only exacerbated the hurt feelings.

meanings.sent1: The constant noise from the construction site exacerbated the neighbors.
meanings.sent2: His teasing remarks exacerbated her annoyance.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy exacerbated the grumpiness of the old cat.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive sound of the alarm clock exacerbated his morning grumpiness.
meanings.sent5: The buzzing mosquito exacerbated her frustration as she tried to sleep.
